Most people think that pearls are purely the product of “proud parent” oysters and clams happily residing in safe and secure ocean beds from sea to shining sea. But actually there is a current sweeping interest, popularity and frenzied fashion trend that is now creating a buzz surrounding the lesser known “Freshwater Pearls.” The honored hosts of these gorgeously beautiful, cultured pearls are “freshwater mussels” that live at the bottom of some of the most serenely picturesque ponds, lakes, streams and rivers found all across this lovely blue planet of ours. So why the tremendous increase in popularity now being enjoyed by “Freshwater Pearls?” Basically it all comes down to the basic, fundamental economic principle of “Supply and Demand,” providing you with the wonderful opportunity to enjoy the appearance of wearing a veritable fortune worth of dazzlingly lustrous and ornately iridescent pearls, for a mere fraction of the cost commonly associated with Saltwater pearls. First of all, freshwater mussels are much larger than the typical oysters that provide saltwater pearls and mussels can produce up to thirty-two pearls at a time, unlike their saltwater cousins and counterparts who can only produce a single, solitary pearl at a time. ... object.content:
Pearls Of Wisdom 101: "Insightful Industry Insider Info" brought to you by your friends at The Pearl Outlet.  

ARTICLE: "The Surging Popularity of Freshwater Pearls As “Mussels Show-Off Their Muscles!” - By Terry Shepherd of The Pearl Outlet, Inc. 

Most people think that pearls are purely the product of “proud parent” oysters and clams happily residing in safe and secure ocean beds from sea to shining sea. But actually there is a current sweeping interest, popularity and frenzied fashion trend that is now creating a buzz surrounding the lesser known “Freshwater Pearls.” 

The honored hosts of these gorgeously beautiful, cultured pearls are “freshwater mussels” that live at the bottom of some of the most serenely picturesque ponds, lakes, streams and rivers found all across this lovely blue planet of ours.

So why the tremendous increase in popularity now being enjoyed by “Freshwater Pearls?” Basically it all comes down to the basic, fundamental economic principle of “Supply and Demand,” providing you with the wonderful opportunity to enjoy the appearance of wearing a veritable fortune worth of dazzlingly lustrous and ornately iridescent pearls, for a mere fraction of the cost commonly associated with Saltwater pearls.

First of all, freshwater mussels are much larger than the typical oysters that provide saltwater pearls and mussels can produce up to thirty-two pearls at a time, unlike their saltwater cousins and counterparts who can only produce a single, solitary pearl at a time. ...

To Read More: http://www.thepearloutlet.com/freshwater-pearl-popularity.html
